channel.title: Hiding the client ip
channel.description:
uhm yeah so i just put my server on a vps and i was wondering before i post my new client how do i hide the ip ?
[IMG]http://i30.tinypic.com/2i6igef.jpg[/img]
how do i hide the ip and the port?
please help ill rep+ and maybe pay a couple $ on paypal..

item.title: Hiding the client ip
item.dc:creator: @Divilium Divilium
item.description:
@Divilium wrote:

Yes.
but just first copy it in another .txt file in case something goes wrong.

Div.
Rep++?

Read full topic

item.title: Hiding the client ip
item.dc:creator: @Elven_Dremor Elven Dremor
item.description:
@Elven_Dremor wrote:

       [code] j += 15;
        aClass30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub4_1272.method389(false, true, c / 2 - 90,
                0xffffff,
                "Password: " + Class50.method588(aString1174, 0)
                + ((anInt1216 == 1) & (anInt1105 % 40 < 20) ? "|" : ""),
                j);
        j += 15;
        aClass30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub4_1272.method389(false, true, c / 2 - 90,
                0xfff00,
                "@whi@Server IP: " + server
                + ((anInt1216 == 2) & (anInt1105 % 40 < 20) ? "@xxx@|" : ""),
                j);
        j += 15;
        aClass30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub4_1272.method389(false, true, c / 2 - 90,
                0xfff00,
                "@whi@Port: " + port
                + ((anInt1216 == 3) & (anInt1105 % 40 < 20) ? "@xxx@|" : ""),
                j);
        j += 15;[/code]

so to delete the port and ip i delete this??

aClass30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub4_1272.method389(false, true, c / 2 - 90, 0xfff00, "@whi@Server IP: " + server + ((anInt1216 == 2) & (anInt1105 % 40 < 20) ? "@xxx@|" : ""), j); j += 15; aClass30_Sub2_Sub1_Sub4_1272.method389(false, true, c / 2 - 90, 0xfff00, "@whi@Port: " + port + ((anInt1216 == 3) & (anInt1105 % 40 < 20) ? "@xxx@|" : ""), j); j += 15;

right?

Read full topic

item.title: Hiding the client ip
item.dc:creator: @Divilium Divilium
item.description:
@Divilium wrote:

Hey,
I just figured this out myself but its pretty easy.
go to your client.java
and try to find something like this:

"@whi@Username: " + aString1173 +

somewhere below that you will find the server IP line which will look about the same as the username part.
Just delete this line

I recommend you to do the same with the Port line.

Hope it will help and tell me if you have any errors.

Div.

Read full topic
